clinical_note: 58M with 3-day fever (39.4°C), productive cough with purulent sputum, right pleuritic chest pain, SpO2 88%. CXR: right lower lobe lobar consolidation with air bronchograms.
image_finding_description: Lobar consolidation right lower lobe with air bronchograms.

clinical_note: 42F with mild intermittent dry cough for 2 weeks, no fever, normal SpO2. No wheezing. Symptoms < 2 days/week. No nocturnal symptoms.
image_finding_description: Clear lung fields. No hyperinflation.

clinical_note: 65M with progressive dyspnea, orthopnea, bilateral leg edema. CXR: cardiomegaly, bilateral Kerley B lines, pulmonary vascular congestion.
image_finding_description: Cardiomegaly with Kerley B lines and pulmonary edema.

clinical_note: 55M post-motor vehicle accident. 2 rib fractures (7th and 8th ribs). Stable vitals. Minor tenderness on palpation. Breathing not compromised.
image_finding_description: Single or dual rib fractures without flail chest.

clinical_note: 72F with severe dyspnea, bilateral crackles, bilateral leg edema, JVD, SpO2 88%. CXR: massive cardiomegaly, bilateral pulmonary edema, Kerley B lines.
image_finding_description: Cardiomegaly, bilateral pulmonary edema, Kerley B lines.

clinical_note: 49M with bilateral wheezing, barrel chest, prolonged expiration. CXR: hyperinflation, bilateral air trapping, flattened diaphragms. SpO2 91%.
image_finding_description: Hyperinflation with bilateral air trapping and flattened diaphragms.

clinical_note: 61M with epigastric pain worsening at night, hematemesis episode. Endoscopy pending. History of NSAID use. H. pylori positive.
image_finding_description: No radiographic findings (endoscopy case).

clinical_note: 38F with occasional heartburn after meals. No hematemesis, no weight loss. Responds to antacids. H. pylori negative.
image_finding_description: No acute findings on imaging.

clinical_note: 45M evaluated for possible pneumonia. CXR clear, no consolidation. Mild upper respiratory symptoms only. No fever > 38°C.
image_finding_description: Clear chest X-ray, no acute findings.

clinical_note: 32M with knee pain after sports injury. No respiratory symptoms. Normal chest if incidental imaging performed.
image_finding_description: Clear lungs (incidental), knee soft tissue swelling.

clinical_note: 67M, bilateral leg swelling, dyspnea on exertion. Echo: EF 30%. BNP elevated 1200 pg/mL. CXR: cardiomegaly, bilateral pleural effusions.
image_finding_description: Cardiomegaly with bilateral pleural effusions.

clinical_note: 53F post fall from height. Single rib fracture (4th rib). Normal breathing mechanics, SpO2 98%. No paradoxical motion.
image_finding_description: Single rib fracture, no flail segment.

clinical_note: Multiple rib fractures (ribs 5-9 bilateral) after crush injury. Paradoxical chest wall movement. Intubated for respiratory failure. Flail chest pattern.
image_finding_description: Multiple bilateral rib fractures with flail chest pattern.

clinical_note: 28F with appendicitis-like symptoms. RLQ pain, fever 38.5°C, elevated WBC. CT abdomen pending. Unrelated chest X-ray.
image_finding_description: Clear chest X-ray. Appendicitis not captured in chest imaging.

clinical_note: 55M with severe asthma exacerbation. Peak flow <40% predicted. Required IV magnesium, continuous nebulizers, ICU admission. CXR: bilateral hyperinflation, air trapping.
image_finding_description: Bilateral hyperinflation with air trapping and flattened diaphragms.

clinical_note: Routine follow-up. Patient presents for monitoring after recent hospitalization. No active symptoms. Evaluation only, no acute diagnosis made.
image_finding_description: Normal chest X-ray.

clinical_note: 48M with mild occasional wheezing, 1-2 episodes per month. Good exercise tolerance. No nighttime symptoms. No SABA use in past week.
image_finding_description: Mild hyperinflation only.

clinical_note: 70M admitted with pneumonia and sepsis. WBC 22k, lactate 3.1. CXR: bilateral consolidations. Admitted to ICU. Vasopressors required.
image_finding_description: Bilateral lobar consolidations, air bronchograms.

clinical_note: 35F presenting for anxiety and palpitations. No chest pain, no dyspnea. Normal 12-lead EKG. Cardiac workup negative.
image_finding_description: Normal cardiac silhouette. No Kerley B lines.

clinical_note: 47M with H. pylori positive, acute epigastric pain, confirmed gastric ulcer on endoscopy with active bleeding. Hematemesis present.
image_finding_description: No chest findings (gastric ulcer is GI not chest).

clinical_note: 63M with right-sided pleuritic chest pain, high fever, consolidation RUL. Productive cough with rust-colored sputum. SpO2 90%.
image_finding_description: Right upper lobe consolidation with air bronchograms.

clinical_note: 34F with 3 broken ribs on left side from fall. Breathing intact, SpO2 99%. No paradoxical motion observed.
image_finding_description: Three rib fractures left side, no flail chest.

clinical_note: 78M with long-standing CHF. Recent decompensation: weight gain 8 lbs in 1 week, increasing edema, PND. BNP 2800. CXR: cardiomegaly, bilateral infiltrates.
image_finding_description: Massive cardiomegaly with bilateral pulmonary edema.

clinical_note: 25M with ankle fracture from basketball. No cardiopulmonary symptoms. Healthy appearing, SpO2 100%.
image_finding_description: Normal chest X-ray if obtained.

clinical_note: 58F with multiple rib fractures (6-10 left) from MVA. Paradoxical motion of left chest wall. Respiratory distress. Mechanical ventilation initiated.
image_finding_description: Multiple left rib fractures with flail segment.

clinical_note: 69M, classic CHF presentation: bilateral leg pitting edema 3+, orthopnea 3 pillows, bilateral crackles. Echo EF 25%. CXR: cardiomegaly, Kerley B lines.
image_finding_description: Cardiomegaly, Kerley B lines, bilateral pulmonary edema.

clinical_note: 44M with mild stomach pain for 3 months. No hematemesis. Slightly elevated gastrin. H. pylori testing pending. Endoscopy scheduled.
image_finding_description: No relevant imaging findings.

clinical_note: 55M with severe COPD exacerbation. History of 60 pack-years. Barrel chest, prolonged expiration, diffuse wheezing. CXR: hyperinflation, flattened diaphragms.
image_finding_description: Bilateral hyperinflation with flattened diaphragms and air trapping.

clinical_note: 19F with migraine, photophobia, phonophobia. No respiratory symptoms. Normal neurological exam except headache.
image_finding_description: No chest symptoms or findings.

clinical_note: 51F after minor car accident. Single rib fracture identified on imaging. Breathing normally, chest wall stable.
image_finding_description: Single rib fracture, no flail chest pattern.

clinical_note: 75F with new-onset heart failure. Ejection fraction 20%. Bilateral crackles, 3+ pitting edema, dyspnea at rest. BNP 4200. Kerley B lines on CXR.
image_finding_description: Cardiomegaly, bilateral Kerley B lines, pulmonary edema.

clinical_note: 50M with lobar pneumonia confirmed by CT. Fever 38.9°C, productive cough, right lower lobe consolidation. Admitted for IV antibiotics.
image_finding_description: Right lower lobe lobar consolidation with air bronchograms.

clinical_note: 30M presenting with skin rash, joint pain. Rheumatological workup in progress. No respiratory complaints.
image_finding_description: Normal cardiac silhouette if chest X-ray obtained.

clinical_note: 60F with well-controlled asthma. Using SABA < 2x/week. No nighttime awakenings. FEV1 > 80% predicted. CXR: clear, no hyperinflation.
image_finding_description: Clear chest X-ray, no hyperinflation.

clinical_note: 56M, chest trauma from construction accident. 7 fractured ribs (4-10, right). Paradoxical wall movement. Mechanically ventilated.
image_finding_description: Multiple right rib fractures with flail chest pattern.

clinical_note: 42M with known peptic ulcer disease, now with acute epigastric bleeding. Hemoglobin drop 4g/dL. Endoscopy shows active bleeding ulcer. H. pylori positive.
image_finding_description: Not applicable (GI finding).

clinical_note: 22F with UTI symptoms — dysuria, frequency, suprapubic pain. Urine culture positive E. coli. No respiratory involvement.
image_finding_description: No chest findings.

clinical_note: 80F with acute decompensated CHF requiring ICU. BNP 9800, EF 15%. Triple diuretic therapy. BiPAP initiated. CXR: massive cardiomegaly, pulmonary edema.
image_finding_description: Massive cardiomegaly, bilateral pulmonary edema, Kerley B lines.

clinical_note: 39M with 2 rib fractures on right side after sports injury. SpO2 100%. Breathing without difficulty. No paradoxical motion.
image_finding_description: Two rib fractures right side without flail chest.

clinical_note: 36M with runny nose, sore throat, sneezing for 3 days. Low grade fever 37.5°C. CXR clear. No lower tract involvement. Self-limiting viral illness.
image_finding_description: Clear chest X-ray, no acute pulmonary findings.

clinical_note: 66F admitted with bilateral pneumonia, requiring ICU care. Intubated. WBC 28k. CXR: bilateral consolidations. Blood culture growing S. pneumoniae.
image_finding_description: Bilateral lobar consolidations with air bronchograms.

clinical_note: 52M with mild heartburn and occasional epigastric discomfort. H. pylori negative. No bleeding or endoscopic evidence of active ulceration.
image_finding_description: No radiological GI findings.

clinical_note: 15M with Lyme disease. Recent tick bite, bullseye rash, joint pain. No respiratory symptoms. Antibiotic treatment initiated.
image_finding_description: No chest symptoms or findings.

clinical_note: 51M with decompensated systolic CHF. Presenting for cardiology evaluation. CXR confirms cardiomegaly, bilateral Kerley B lines, pulmonary vascular redistribution.
image_finding_description: Cardiomegaly, Kerley B lines, pulmonary edema.

clinical_note: 57M with status asthmaticus. Unresponsive to bronchodilators. Peak flow 25% predicted. ICU admission. Near-fatal episode. CXR: hyperinflation, air trapping.
image_finding_description: Severe bilateral hyperinflation with flattened diaphragms and air trapping.

clinical_note: 40M with 1 rib fracture at 8th rib, minor blunt trauma. Normal breathing, SpO2 99%, no respiratory compromise.
image_finding_description: Single 8th rib fracture, no flail chest.

clinical_note: 26F with gestational diabetes, 32 weeks pregnant. Routine prenatal visit. No cardiopulmonary symptoms.
image_finding_description: No relevant findings.

clinical_note: 62F with gastric ulcer confirmed on EGD. Active epigastric pain with hematemesis. H. pylori eradication treatment started. Admitted for monitoring.
image_finding_description: GI finding; no chest X-ray abnormality.

clinical_note: 74M with severe pneumonia and multi-organ dysfunction. Intubated day 3. Chest: bilateral opacities consistent with ARDS pattern. WBC 35k.
image_finding_description: Bilateral consolidations, ARDS pattern.

clinical_note: 45F with episodic wheezing responding to PRN albuterol. Symptoms 1-2x/month, no nighttime symptoms. FEV1 85%.
image_finding_description: Clear or mild hyperinflation only.

clinical_note: 69M with acute on chronic CHF. New-onset dyspnea, bilateral crackles, JVD. Echo: EF 20%. BNP 5500. CXR: cardiomegaly, bilateral pulmonary edema.
image_finding_description: Cardiomegaly with bilateral pulmonary edema.

clinical_note: 48M with severe persistent asthma. Daily wheezing, nighttime awakenings 4x/week. Barrel chest. CXR: marked hyperinflation, bilateral air trapping, flattened diaphragms.
image_finding_description: Marked bilateral hyperinflation with flattened diaphragms and air trapping.

clinical_note: 33M with depression, insomnia. No physical complaints. Mental health evaluation. No systemic or cardiopulmonary symptoms.
image_finding_description: Normal chest if incidental imaging.

clinical_note: 37F with 2 rib fractures after fall, breathing normally. SpO2 100%. No rib instability.
image_finding_description: Two rib fractures, no flail chest.

clinical_note: 53F with MALT lymphoma and acute bleeding gastric ulcer. Active hematemesis, Hgb 5.2. Emergency endoscopy performed.
image_finding_description: GI finding, no chest imaging relevant.

clinical_note: Patient evaluated in ER but no acute diagnosis made. Observation only. Vital signs stable. Chest X-ray unremarkable. Discharged without definitive diagnosis.
image_finding_description: Normal chest X-ray.

clinical_note: 8M pediatric patient with otitis media. Ear pain, fever 38.2°C. No respiratory symptoms. Treated with amoxicillin.
image_finding_description: No chest imaging findings.

clinical_note: 61M with massive pleural effusion secondary to CHF. EF 18%. Dyspnea at rest, bilateral crackles, peripheral edema 3+. BNP 8700.
image_finding_description: Cardiomegaly, bilateral pleural effusions, Kerley B lines.

clinical_note: 55M with epigastric discomfort. No hematemesis, no weight loss, no alarm symptoms. H. pylori status unknown, starting PPI empirically.
image_finding_description: No imaging findings.

clinical_note: 52M, fractured ribs 5-8 bilaterally in a fall from scaffold. Paradoxical chest wall movement observed. Respiratory failure requiring intubation. ICU admission.
image_finding_description: Bilateral multiple rib fractures with flail chest segment.

clinical_note: 71M with large-scale chest trauma. Ribs 3-9 fractured on right. Flail segment, paradoxical breathing. Required emergent intubation.
image_finding_description: Multiple rib fractures with flail chest pattern.

clinical_note: 50M with deep vein thrombosis in left leg. Leg swelling and pain, D-dimer elevated. No pulmonary embolism symptoms.
image_finding_description: Normal chest X-ray (DVT is lower extremity finding).

clinical_note: 29M with mild sneezing and nasal congestion for 4 days. Temperature 37.3°C. CXR clear. Self-limiting viral URTI.
image_finding_description: Clear chest X-ray, no consolidation.

clinical_note: 64F with type 2 peptic ulcer without current hemorrhage or perforation. H. pylori positive, asymptomatic currently. Maintenance PPI therapy.
image_finding_description: No imaging findings (GI).

clinical_note: 48F with new left-sided weakness and facial droop. CT head: ischemic stroke. History of CHF. No respiratory complaints.
image_finding_description: CT head abnormal; chest X-ray not primary finding.

clinical_note: 43M with mild intermittent asthma, last exacerbation 6 months ago. Good control with PRN albuterol. FEV1 82%.
image_finding_description: Minimal hyperinflation only.

clinical_note: 72M with pneumococcal lobar pneumonia. Right lower lobe consolidation confirmed by CT. Fever 39.1°C, productive cough, SpO2 89%. IV ceftriaxone initiated.
image_finding_description: Right lower lobe consolidation with air bronchograms on CT.

clinical_note: 67M with Parkinson's disease tremor, cognitive decline. Neurology referral. No cardiopulmonary symptoms.
image_finding_description: Not applicable.

clinical_note: 54M with multi-rib fractures (ribs 4-8) after MVA. Flail segment present. Intubated in field. Chest stabilization surgery scheduled.
image_finding_description: Multiple rib fractures with flail chest.

clinical_note: 30F with occasional dyspepsia and acid reflux. No hematemesis. EGD scheduled but not yet done. Functional GI symptoms likely.
image_finding_description: No relevant radiological findings.

clinical_note: 62M with confirmed upper respiratory viral infection, no fever > 38°C, no lower tract involvement, CXR normal. Symptomatic treatment only.
image_finding_description: Clear chest X-ray.

clinical_note: 45F with hyperthyroidism, palpitations, heat intolerance. TSH suppressed. No cardiopulmonary findings.
image_finding_description: Normal cardiac size. No pulmonary edema.

clinical_note: 73F with severe asthma attack requiring ECMO after failing conventional ventilation. Peak flow 10% predicted.
image_finding_description: Severe bilateral hyperinflation, air trapping.

clinical_note: 47M with isolated 6th rib fracture. Good pain control. SpO2 98%. No respiratory difficulty. Discharged home.
image_finding_description: Single rib fracture, no flail.

clinical_note: 55M with decompensated CHF. Bilateral crackles, cardiomegaly on CXR, Kerley B lines, bilateral edema 3+. EF 22%. BNP 7800.
image_finding_description: Cardiomegaly, bilateral Kerley B lines, pulmonary edema.

clinical_note: 58M with peptic ulcer bleeding confirmed on EGD. Hemoglobin dropped from 12 to 7.5. Blood transfusion required. H. pylori positive.
image_finding_description: No chest imaging relevant.

clinical_note: 18F with iron deficiency anemia, fatigue, pallor, Hgb 7.2. Menorrhagia history. No cardiopulmonary symptoms.
image_finding_description: Normal chest if obtained.

clinical_note: 32M with sneezing, runny nose, mild pharyngitis. Temperature 37.4°C. CXR clear. Diagnosed with acute viral upper respiratory infection.
image_finding_description: Clear chest X-ray.

clinical_note: 66M with fractured ribs 5-11 (7 ribs) bilaterally, paradoxical chest wall movement, hypoxia requiring emergent intubation.
image_finding_description: Multiple bilateral rib fractures with flail chest pattern.

clinical_note: 55M with type 2 diabetes, HbA1c 9.8%. Presenting for glycemic management. No acute cardiac or pulmonary complaints.
image_finding_description: Normal CXR if performed.

clinical_note: 79F with aspiration pneumonia. Right lower lobe consolidation. Aspiration event confirmed by nursing. Fever 38.8°C, SpO2 87%.
image_finding_description: Right lower lobe consolidation from aspiration.

clinical_note: 38F with mild episodic asthma. Last ER visit 2 years ago. Well-controlled on low-dose ICS. No current exacerbation.
image_finding_description: Clear or minimal hyperinflation.

clinical_note: 56M with mild asthma, well-controlled, using PRN albuterol < 2x/week, no nighttime symptoms, FEV1 80%, no recent ER visits.
image_finding_description: Clear chest X-ray or minimal hyperinflation.

clinical_note: 40M with gout flare. Right big toe swelling, uric acid 9.8. No systemic or pulmonary involvement.
image_finding_description: No chest findings.

clinical_note: 65M with new-onset systolic CHF discovered after cardiac arrest, EF 10%. Resuscitated, intubated. BNP 15000. CXR: massive cardiomegaly, bilateral edema.
image_finding_description: Massive cardiomegaly, severe bilateral pulmonary edema, Kerley B lines.

clinical_note: 26M with indigestion, no vomiting, no hematemesis. Mild epigastric discomfort postprandially. No weight loss or alarm symptoms.
image_finding_description: No imaging abnormalities.

clinical_note: 39M with aspiration pneumonia, right lower lobe consolidation, fever 38.5°C, SpO2 91%. IV antibiotics initiated.
image_finding_description: Right lower lobe lobar consolidation with air bronchograms.

clinical_note: 72M with hip fracture after fall. Pain, unable to bear weight. No pulmonary or cardiac symptoms.
image_finding_description: Hip fracture on pelvic X-ray. Chest clear.

clinical_note: 77M with CHF exacerbation. Previously compensated, now requiring hospitalization for escalating IV diuretics. CXR: cardiomegaly, bilateral edema.
image_finding_description: Cardiomegaly, bilateral pulmonary edema, Kerley B lines.

clinical_note: 35M with 3 rib fractures (ribs 5-7) after sports. Breathing unaffected. SpO2 100%. Managed with analgesics as outpatient.
image_finding_description: Three rib fractures without flail chest.

clinical_note: Patient admitted for observation after suspicious symptoms. All tests returned normal. No specific diagnosis established. Discharged in good condition.
image_finding_description: Normal CXR.

clinical_note: 58M with renal failure requiring hemodialysis. Fluid overload, hyperkalemia. No primary CHF diagnosis.
image_finding_description: Fluid overload on CXR (secondary to renal failure, not cardiac).

clinical_note: 48M, active GERD symptoms with confirmed bleeding peptic ulcer on EGD. Hgb 6.8, transfusion required. H. pylori positive.
image_finding_description: No chest findings (GI case).

clinical_note: 49M with occasional wheezing 1x/month. Mild intermittent asthma well-controlled. No hospitalization in 5 years. FEV1 88%.
image_finding_description: Normal chest X-ray.

clinical_note: Observation admission, no diagnosis required. Patient monitored overnight post-procedure. All vitals stable, no acute findings on any testing.
image_finding_description: Normal CXR.

clinical_note: 34M with new diagnosis of HIV. CD4 count 450. Starting antiretroviral therapy. No respiratory symptoms.
image_finding_description: Normal chest X-ray.

clinical_note: 69M with severe bilateral pneumonia requiring intubation. Lobar consolidation on CT. ICU day 5. WBC 30k, fever 39.5°C.
image_finding_description: Bilateral lobar consolidations with air bronchograms.

clinical_note: 41M with rhinitis, sneezing and mild sore throat. No lower respiratory tract involvement. CXR unremarkable.
image_finding_description: Clear chest X-ray.

clinical_note: 57F with severe CHF, NYHA class IV, cardiomegaly confirmed by echo. CXR: bilateral Kerley B lines, pulmonary vascular prominence. EF 18%.
image_finding_description: Cardiomegaly, bilateral Kerley B lines, pulmonary edema.

clinical_note: 63M with prostate cancer, PSA 45. Bone scan positive for metastases. No cardiac or respiratory symptoms.
image_finding_description: No chest imaging findings relevant to asthma.
